There were lots of nice things about this house. It was reasonably spacious and pleasantly furnished, easy to locate, quiet, and the beds and linens were extremely comfortable. However, things could have been better with a little more effort and maintenance, at minimal cost to the owner. With respect to maintenance, the lightbulb in the downstairs toilet (which is tiny - more of a 1/4 bathroom than a 1/2 bathroom) was burned out, and a bolt was missing from the seat; many of the doors upstairs did not actually close; the doors upstairs also needed oiling; the coffee pot was not working properly. It would have been difficult to use the lovely cookbook that was there since the kitchen was missing basic items like cutting knives, a bread knife (or at least a serrated knife), a cutting board, and a grater. There also were no small glasses or wine glasses. In addition, there was only service for 4 .
